conclusion: To ensure total reflection, turning radius r must be greater than the radius of curvature of the semicircular cross section.
Radius of curvature of a circular cross section is given by R = d/2.
Given diameter D of the optical fiber, radius of curvature R is R = D/2.
Turning radius r must be greater than radius of curvature R: r > D/2.
Turning radius r should be not less than r = D/2.
